intro: Orbea laticorona, commonly known as the broad-veined orbea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. It typically grows as a succulent shrub, with fleshy, spiny stems and leaves. Orbea laticorona is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is well-suited to arid environments.
